topic.title: Creating/Extending a Custom Framework through an XML Descriptor File
topic.shortdesc: A custom framework (document type) can be created using a special XML descriptor, either from scratch or by extending an existing built-in framework, such as DITA or DocBook, and then making modifications to it. You can then easily share the custom framework with your team.

body.p: The easiest way to create such a descriptor is to use the New document wizard and choose the Extend Framework Script or Create Framework Script template.

section.title: Creating a custom framework starting from an existing one
section.p:
Let's assume we want to create a custom framework by extending an existing one, more precisely the built-in DITA framework. Follow these steps:
In a location where you have full write access, create a folder structure similar to this: custom_frameworks/dita-extension.
and go to
Document Type Association Locations . Add the path to your custom_frameworks folder in the Additional frameworks directories list and click OK or Apply to save your changes.
Click OK to close the configuration dialog box and then OK or Apply to save your changes.
Click New... on the toolbar and select the Extend Framework Script template. Save it inside the previously configured framework path, custom_frameworks/dita-extension.
Set the @base attribute on the script element to the value of the extended framework's name. In this case, DITA Removing the @base attribute will create a framework from scratch.
Edit the script as described in .
Compile the script to obtain the *.framework file by using the Compile Framework Extension script action from the editor contextual menu or by running the scripts/compileFrameworkScript.bat external tool.
